alert.note: Alert for Greene (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 5:07PM CDT until August 05 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Greene County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 800 PM CDT. * At 507 PM CDT, Emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Springfield. The expected rainfall rate is 1.5 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is already occurring. Flash flooding has begun in the city of Springfield and will continue to worsen as this thunderstorm remains nearly stationary over the city. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. This thunderstorm continues to impact the upper headwaters of Jordan and Fassnight Creeks. Flash flooding is expected within these two basins, which will runoff into Wilson`s Creek soon after. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Springfield, Battlefield and Brookline. This includes the following low water crossings... Wilson`s Creek at Farm Road 150, Wilson Creek at Farm Road 156 and Wilson Creek at Farm Road 146. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
